Announcement.Title: Two new features worth checking out...
Announcement.Message:
I would like to draw your attention to two new features of the latest version of Whitebox (v. 3.1.1). The Request New Feature tool, located in the tools tab and in the Help menu, can be used to send a feature request to the Whitebox development team. Features that have a greater number of requests will move higher in the development priority queue, so send us your most wanted new features! The second addition is the new Error Reporting feature, also found under the Help menu. When you are using Whitebox and encounter an error, use the new reporting tool to send the development team a description of the error you encountered. The tool will automatically send us a copy of your log files as well so that we can get a better idea of what went wrong. Both these new features will help us to further improve Whitebox.

Announcement.Title: Join the Whitebox Listserv
Announcement.Message:
If you would like to join the Whitebox GAT listserv send an email message to listserv@listserv.uoguelph.ca that says only:

SUBSCRIBE whitebox-gat your name

If you have an email signature, be sure to delete it from your message. To post a message, email whitebox-gat@listserv.uoguelph.ca.

You can use the listserv to get help from Whitebox experts and offer your expertise to the Whitebox user community. It's also a great way to catch up on recent developments.

Announcement.Title: Check your Java version if you are running on MS Windows
Announcement.Message:
The default Java Runtime Environment (JRE) for download on the Oracle site for computers running Microsoft Windows OS is the 32-bit version even if you are running a 64-bit version of the operating system. This will severely limit the amount of memory that Whitebox can access and will affect performance and can lead to out-of-memory errors when handling large files. Given the large number of Windows users, this affects many people.

You can check what version of the JRE Whitebox is running under by selecting Options and Settings under the View menu. If you are running the 32-bit version on a 64-bit computer it would be advisable to upgrade your Java to the 64-bit version.
